_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:32:05 using v2.7
title: How does the proportion spent on home care vary within each client group budget?
analysis_commentary: Overall, older people have the highest proportion spent on home care, in 2013-14 this was 21%. This had been fairly steady, around 23%, since 1996-97 to 2010-11 and since then it has decreased to 21% in 2013-14. For adults under 65 with a physical or sensory disability, the proportion spent on home care initially increased to a high of 23% in 2001-02, since then it has decreased to 19% in 2013-14. For adults under 65 with learning disabilities, the proportion has generally increased. This increased from 2% in 1994-95 to a high of 14% in 2010-11; since then it has decreased slightly to 13% in 2013-14. Adults under 65 with mental health needs has the lowest proportion spent on home care overall, this has been fairly steady around 5-6%, however, this increased slightly from 2009-10 to 7% in 2013-14.
data_source: Health & social care information centre, Personal Social Services Expenditure and Unit Costs
